capabilities.name: Smart Routing
capabilities.description: With Smart Routing the customer is directed to the right source of information using the right channel. It makes sure the customer get the correct response as soon as possible and avoid the customer being redirected many times before the right agent can help.

capabilities.name: Content Management
capabilities.description: Content Management is collection, delivery, retrieval, governance and overall management of information in any format. Having a Content Management solution for your organization allows you to have control of your content. It means having the ability to update, change or delete any images, text, video, or audio. Content Management includes text, rich media, graphics, photos, video and audio for any channel. To create a consistent message via all channels it is crucial to place Content Management from one single source to all channels, online and offline. The Content Management solution will deliver content to web, app, email marketing, social marketing, customer service agents, workforce, shops, field mechanics, etc. A Content Manager is a professional who has a unique role in developing the company's brand and establishing its online presence.

capabilities.name: Content Search
capabilities.description: Description to come soon!

capabilities.name: Digital Assets Search
capabilities.description: Description to come soon!

capabilities.name: Knowledge Search (FAQ)
capabilities.description: Description to come soon!

capabilities.name: Merchandising
capabilities.description: Description to come soon!

capabilities.name: Product Search
capabilities.description: Description to come soon!

capabilities.name: Optimize Search Results
capabilities.description: Description to come soon!

capabilities.name: Search
capabilities.description: Search allows customers to better seek information on products and services the organization offers and help customers make better decisions what product or service they need. An Enterprise Search is connected to many data sources, like Product Data, Content, Knowledge Articles, Digital Assets, etc. Search can be personalized using customer data, like interests, browsing behavior, previous bought products or services or profile data. A search query can be executed by inputting text in a search field or, when connected to a conversational platform, via chatbot or voicebot. A strong benefit of a good search is to avoid customers calling Customer Service Agents with their questions and enable more self-service for the customers.

capabilities.name: Audience Management
capabilities.description: Audience Management is the process of sourcing, managing, analyzing, defining, and activating customer data for cross channel campaigns. The objective is that the right message reaches the right audience at the right moment on the right channel, and therefor optimizing campaign's result.

capabilities.name: Brand Management
capabilities.description: Brand Management includes analysis on how the brand is currently perceived by customers, a strategic plan how the brand should be perceived and ensuring that the brand is perceived as planned and secures its objectives. Developing a good relationship with customer is essential for Brand Management. With Brand management an organization can centralize their brand management activities, content, and messaging. Like its mission statement, visual elements (“look & feel”, logo), tone of voice and “personality” and target audience.

capabilities.name: Channel Management & Routing
capabilities.description: Via a smart routing (rule) engine the customer is routed or directed to correct resource. That could be a service agent with the requested expertise or a self-service portal or a chatbot that can quickly respond to the of the customer.

capabilities.name: Chatbot
capabilities.description: At the most basic level, a chatbot is a computer program that simulates and processes human conversation (either written or spoken), allowing humans to interact with digital devices as if they were communicating with a real person. Chatbots can be as simple as rudimentary programs that answer a simple query with a single-line response, or as sophisticated as digital assistants that learn and evolve to deliver increasing levels of personalization as they gather and process information. They allow companies to easily resolve many types of customer queries and issues while reducing the need for human interaction.

capabilities.name: CIAM
capabilities.description: Customer identity and access management (CIAM) ensures that customers are allowed to access certain areas of your network or an application and manages their identification information within your system.

capabilities.name: Community Management
capabilities.description: Community management is building an authentic community among a business's customers, employees, and partners through various types of interaction. It's how a brand interact with their audience to create a network in which they can connect, share, and grow. Nurturing groups of people around ANWB brand or organization, and stimulating interaction between community members and generation of user content.

capabilities.name: Consent Management
capabilities.description: Consent management helps ensure compliance by informing customers about a company’s data collection and usage practices and honoring those choices. Consent and preference management can keep companies compliant with current and emerging data privacy regulations, reducing the chances of being fined. Companies that practice consent and preference management can create brand trust and credibility by letting their customers have a say in if, how, and when their personal data can be used. Companies can also improve their marketing efforts when customers request particular information about products and services.

capabilities.name: Contact Management
capabilities.description: Contact Management records interactions between a company and its customers, partners, or other contacts, such as phone calls, emails, and meetings. This information can be helpful for sales and marketing purposes, as it can help identify potential customers and track the progress of sales opportunities.

capabilities.name: Conversational
capabilities.description: Description to come soon!

capabilities.name: Customer Journey Management
capabilities.description: Understand and manage the customer journey of your customers over your channels. Know when customers are happy, when they need attention or when the journey is broken to act quickly, engage with the customer in their journey and increase customer satisfaction.

capabilities.name: Customer Management
capabilities.description: Customer data management is the ways in which organizations keep track of their customer information and create a single source of truth across the organization. It deliver all operational customer data to other systems in the organization IT landscape.

capabilities.name: Customer (Master) Data Management
capabilities.description: Description to come soon!

capabilities.name: Customer Experience Management
capabilities.description: Customer Experience Management (CXM) is the discipline of understanding customers and deploying strategic plans that enable cross functional efforts and customer centric culture to improve satisfaction, loyalty and advocacy. The goal of customer experience management is to build customer loyalty and to reduce customer churn.

capabilities.name: My Profile
capabilities.description: Allows the customer to see and change all profile data that is stored by the company of that customer. It often is a portal that also allow the customer to start service process, like moving or start a service request or process.

capabilities.name: Preference Management
capabilities.description: Preference management allowing customers to choose how companies communicate with them and the frequency of communications. For instance, customers can notify companies of their preferences on how often and where to receive communications including newsletters, updates about new products and services and marketing emails. Additionally, preference management can also include personal preferences about content, products or services. For instance, how they like to travel or what locations they are interested for vacation.

capabilities.name: Reviews & Rating
capabilities.description: Reviews and Ratings allow customers to share their experience with a product or service, and give it an overall star rating. Customers often rely on this content to make more informed purchase decisions.

capabilities.name: Social Media Management
capabilities.description: Social media management is analyzing social media audiences and developing a strategy that’s tailored to them, creating and distributing content for social media profiles, monitoring online conversations, collaborating with influencers, providing community service, and monitoring, measuring, and reporting on social media performance and ROI.

capabilities.name: Forum
capabilities.description: An (Internet) Forum, or message board, is an online discussion site where people can hold conversations in the form of posted messages. It provides an online exchange of information, ask questions, between people about a particular topic. The forum is monitored by the organization to keep the content appropriate.

capabilities.name: Consumers
capabilities.short_description: Individuals that buy or consume your products and services
capabilities.description: Individuals that buy or consume your products and services

capabilities.name: Large Business
capabilities.short_description: Large enterprises that buy or consume your products and services
capabilities.description: Large enterprises that buy or consume your products and services

capabilities.name: Small Business
capabilities.short_description: Small businesses that buy or consume your products and services
capabilities.description: Small businesses that buy or consume your products and services

capabilities.name: Suppliers
capabilities.short_description: Suppliers that sells your products and services to customers.
capabilities.description: Suppliers that sells your products and services to customers.

capabilities.name: Conversational AI
capabilities.description: Conversational AI enables customers to interact with IT applications the way they would with other humans. Conversational AI has primarily taken the form of advanced chatbots via both speech and text. It includes managing the output of the dialogue (content, tone-of-voice, ..), but also natural language processing (NLP) and intent and sentiment recognition. With Conversational AI a lot of customer data is gathered and analyzed by listening to the customer and from their perspective. Other then just the factual complaint itself, also the emotions and reasoning is captured.

capabilities.name: Customer Journey Design
capabilities.description: Description to come soon!

capabilities.name: Customer Journey Orchestration
capabilities.description: Description to come soon!

capabilities.name: Letters
capabilities.description: Description to come soon!

capabilities.name: Push Messages
capabilities.description: Push notifications are messages that pop up on a user’s mobile phone or desktop device via their chosen web browser. These little banners slide into view — whether or not your app or website is open. Before viewing these messages from companies, a user must have downloaded the mobile app and opted into notifications. Push notifications are received prominently and can convey real-time updates, transactional messages, reminders, and more.

capabilities.name: Service Messages
capabilities.description: Description to come soon!

capabilities.name: Email SMTP
capabilities.description: Description to come soon!

capabilities.name: Voicebot
capabilities.description: A voicebot enables its user to interact with a device or a service simply by speaking. Powered by artificial intelligence and Natural Language Processing (NLP), a voicebot can understand a spoken question or request and structure a fitting audio response. Voice is the quickest form of human communication - faster than typing or navigating drop down menus with a mouse.

capabilities.name: BPM
capabilities.description: Business process management (BPM) is a discipline that uses various methods to discover, model, analyze, measure, improve and optimize business processes. A business process coordinates the behavior of people, systems, information and things to produce business outcomes in support of a business strategy.

capabilities.name: Task Automation
capabilities.description: Task automation is the use of software to reduce the manual handling of simple tasks or a series of more complex tasks with the goal of making processes more efficient and employees more productive.

capabilities.name: Task & Workflow Management
capabilities.description: Description to come soon!

capabilities.name: Workflow Management
capabilities.description: Workflow management is the discipline of creating, documenting, monitoring and improving upon the series of steps, or workflow, that is required to complete a specific task. The aim of workflow management is to optimize the steps in the workflow to ensure the task is completed correctly, consistently and efficiently.

capabilities.name: Content Recommendation
capabilities.description: Description to come soon!

capabilities.name: Loyalty & Rewards
capabilities.description: Providing a loyalty program to strengthen the relation with customer, retain customers and encourage customers to continue buying products and services of your organization, rather than competitors. It helps your brand target the right audience and then provides benefits, experiences, and rewards that drive long-term engagement.

capabilities.name: Next Best Action
capabilities.description: Description to come soon!

capabilities.name: Personalization
capabilities.description: Personalization is tailoring an interaction or conversation based on information a company has learned about an individual. Just like you may tailor a gift for a good friend, companies can tailor content, product offerings and promotions based on information they learn about their customers. Personalization is especially effective at driving repeat engagement and loyalty over time. Recurring interactions create more data from which brands can design ever-more relevant experiences— creating a flywheel effect that generates strong, long-term customer lifetime value and loyalty.

capabilities.name: Product Recommendation
capabilities.description: Description to come soon!

capabilities.name: Recommendations
capabilities.description: Recommendations of content, products or services based on behavior data. When a customer requested content or bought a product, or added to the shopping cart, that data can be used to recommend other content or products that might be relevant and interesting.

capabilities.name: Campaign Management
capabilities.description: (Marketing) Campaign Management is the planning, executing, tracking and analysis of direct marketing campaigns. These tasks span the entire lifecycle of a marketing campaign, from inception to launch to evaluation of result.

capabilities.name: Proposition Management
capabilities.description: With Proposition Management you can create propositions for customers that include one or multiple products or services. A proposition is often an offering to a group of target customers, or market segment, who have a particular market problem.

capabilities.name: Promotions
capabilities.description: (Product) Promotions are used to encourage customers to buy their products. It can be exclusive deals, discounts and other opportunities for a limited amount of time, enticing customers to purchase products or services.

capabilities.name: Propositions
capabilities.description: Description to come soon!

capabilities.name: Segmentation
capabilities.description: Segmentation is a marketing strategy in which groups of consumers with common needs are identified so that certain products or services can be presented to them in a way that appeals to their interests. Markets can be segmented in several ways such as geographically, demographically, or behaviorally. Market segmentation helps companies minimize risk by figuring out which products are the most likely to earn a share of a target market and the best ways to market and deliver those products to the market.

capabilities.name: Franchises
capabilities.short_description: Partners and/or stores that (re)sell your products and services under your brand name.
capabilities.description: Partners and/or stores that (re)sell your products and services under your brand name.

capabilities.name: Resellers
capabilities.short_description: Partners and/or stores that (re)sell your products and services under their own brand name.
capabilities.description: Partners and/or stores that (re)sell your products and services under their own brand name.

capabilities.name: Joint Promotions
capabilities.description: Your organization and it channels can be used as a platform to partners and suppliers to promote their products and services. These promotions can be jointly offering a proposition for example combining a product from a partner together with a services from your organization.

capabilities.name: Private Label Products
capabilities.description: A private label product is one that your organizations gets produced by a third-party but sells under your own brand name.

capabilities.name: Third party Products
capabilities.description: A third party product is one that your organization buys from a partner and resells using your channels. In this case you are the reseller.

capabilities.name: Cart & Checkout
capabilities.description: Checkout is the point in the shopping /buying process where customer finalize their purchases and pay for products or services. It is where the customer finalizes choices about the product, selects any add-ons, confirms shipping options, then provides payment.

capabilities.name: Content Hub
capabilities.description: Description to come soon!

capabilities.name: Digital Asset Management
capabilities.description: Description to come soon!

capabilities.name: Funnel Management
capabilities.description: (Sales) Funnel Management is organizing, tracking, and prioritizing potential customer interactions to understand the winning change of sales. It helps ensure efficient use of time and sales resources.

capabilities.name: Knowledge Management
capabilities.description: Description to come soon!

capabilities.name: Marketplace
capabilities.description: A marketplace is a platform where your partners can sell their products and services under your brand or label. The role of a marketplace owner is to bring together the right vendors and the right customers to drive sales through an exceptional multi-vendor platform - sellers have a place to gain visibility and sell their products, and the marketplace owner earns a commission from each sale.

capabilities.name: Quote Management
capabilities.description: A quote management solution or configure price quote (CPQ) solution is designed to automate quotations and improve sales efficiency. It helps sales teams effortlessly generate and send quotations, maintain and track shipping information, manage billing, reporting and more.

capabilities.name: Up and Cross sell
capabilities.description: Upselling is encouraging customers to purchase a comparable higher-end product than the one in question, while cross-selling invites customers to buy related or complementary items.

capabilities.name: Case Management
capabilities.description: or Ticket Management. Case Management tracks, manage and respond to customer requests or complaints. For each request or complaint a case or ticket is created and tracked against agreed service levels to ensure adequate response. A case or ticket can be create from a call or email to customer service, a contact form on the website, a chat function from a digital platform or a direct message on a social channel.

capabilities.name: Customer Feedback
capabilities.description: Customer feedback is information provided by customers about their experience with a product or service. Its purpose is to reveal their level of satisfaction and help product, customer success, and marketing teams understand where there is room for improvement. Customer Feedback Management (CFM) is the process of gathering, analyzing and taking action on customer feedback with the goal of optimizing the online customer experience.

capabilities.name: Live chat
capabilities.description: Live chat is a form of customer contact that allows customers to speak directly with a company’s representatives — usually those in customer service and technical support and other roles. Live chat can be integrated to a website or mobile app or connected to a chatbot to takeover an AI conversation.

capabilities.name: Surveys
capabilities.description: A survey is a method of gathering customer feedback using relevant questions from a (selected) group of customer to understand how they perceive a product or service from the company. Surveys consist of pre-defined questions by the company to measure a specific goal or validate a specific objective. Survey can be face-to face, via telephone conversation or online. Customers are likely to respond faster to your online survey because they can be completed with a few clicks. It’s often necessary to code and adjust the data before analyzing, particularly if open-ended questions were asked. Customers want to give their opinions, not personal details. If you already have a customer's information, don’t ask for it again. If you’re collecting sensitive data, make sure you’ re complying with internal policies, local laws, and GDPR.

capabilities.name: Gift Cards
capabilities.description: A gift card is a prepaid debit card that is loaded with a specific amount, which can then be used to make purchases and other financial transactions.

capabilities.name: Home Delivery
capabilities.description: Home delivery is the bringing of items to the customer's home rather than the customer taking or collecting them from the store.

capabilities.name: Loyalty Services
capabilities.description: With a loyalty program, companies can offer points or benefits to customers. And in return, they redeem points for discounts, free products, rewards, or insider perks.

capabilities.name: Pick-up In Store
capabilities.description: or Click & Collect. Buy online, pick up in store ensures that shoppers come into your store, where they may be tempted to buy more. And customers don’t have to deal with shipping costs, long delivery timelines, and shipping back items that don’t fit or meet their expectations.

capabilities.name: Interest Groups
capabilities.short_description: A group of individuals or organizations in close relation to your products or services that attempts to influence public policy in its favor.
capabilities.description: A group of individuals or organizations in close relation to your products or services that attempts to influence public policy in its favor.

capabilities.name: Labour Unions
capabilities.short_description: A labor union is an organization formed by workers in your organization or market sector for the purpose of improving pay, benefits, and working conditions.
capabilities.description: A labor union is an organization formed by workers in your organization or market sector for the purpose of improving pay, benefits, and working conditions.

capabilities.name: Shareholders
capabilities.short_description: A shareholder is a person or institution that has invested money in your organization in exchange for a “share” of the ownership. That ownership is represented by shares issued by the company and held by the shareholder.
capabilities.description: A shareholder is a person or institution that has invested money in your organization in exchange for a “share” of the ownership. That ownership is represented by shares issued by the company and held by the shareholder.

domains.short_description: People or organisations that interact with your organsation, each with their own interest.
domains.description: People or organisations that interact with your organsation, each with their own interest.

domains.name: Stakeholders
domains.short_description: People or organisations that have interest in your organsation.
domains.description: People or organisations that have interest in your organsation.

domains.name: Channels
domains.short_description: All digital and physical channels to connect with your customers, partners and stakeholders to sell or consume your products and services.
domains.description: All digital and physical channels to connect with your customers, partners and stakeholders to sell or consume your products and services.

domains.name: Products & Services
domains.short_description: A high-level overview of all products and services your organisation offers to customers and partners to buy or consume.
domains.description: A high-level overview of all products and services your organisation offers to customers and partners to buy or consume.

domains.name: Products
domains.short_description: A high-level overview of all products your organisation offers to customers and partners to buy or consume.

domains.short_description: A high-level overview of all services your organisation offers to customers and partners to buy or consume.
domains.description: A high-level overview of all services your organisation offers to customers and partners to buy or consume.

domains.name: Platform Services
domains.short_description: A high-level overview of the platform services you can offer to partners to promote or resell their products or services.
domains.description: A high-level overview of the platform services you can offer to partners to promote or resell their products or services.

domains.name: Customer
domains.short_description: Managing your customers, their interactions and their sentiment with your organisation.

domains.name: Marketing
domains.short_description: Bring your offers, campaigns and promotions of your products and services to customers and partners.
domains.description: Bring your offers, campaigns and promotions of your products and services to customers and partners.

domains.name: Sales
domains.short_description: or Commerce. Sell your products and services to customers and partners.
domains.description: or Commerce. Sell your products and services to customers and partners.

domains.name: Service
domains.short_description: Service your customers and partners via their prefered channel with the right message.
domains.description: Service your customers and partners via their prefered channel with the right message.

domains.name: Loyalty
domains.short_description: Increase retention and customer value lifetime with loyalty and personalisation.
domains.description: Increase retention and customer value lifetime with loyalty and personalisation.

domains.name: Content
domains.short_description: Deliver meaningfull and consistent content to your customers and partners via all channels.
domains.description: Deliver meaningfull and consistent content to your customers and partners via all channels.

layers.name: Owned channels
layers.short_description: The Owned channels are Digital channels like websites and apps, Contact channels like  call centre, Print channels like a magazine or flyer and Physical channels like stores and their employees and service engineers. For the Owned Channels we can create, manage, measure and improve the interaction with our customers. We have full control of these channels.
layers.description: The Owned channels are Digital channels like websites and apps, Contact channels like  call centre, Print channels like a magazine or flyer and Physical channels like stores and their employees and service engineers. For the Owned Channels we can create, manage, measure and improve the interaction with our customers. We have full control of these channels.

layers.name: Non-owned channels
layers.short_description: The Non-owned channels are channels we use, but do not own. We do not have full control of these channels, but can use them for conversations and interaction with our customers. For these channels we have to follow their requirements and guidelines for content, interaction and measurement of customer experiences.
layers.description: The Non-owned channels are channels we use, but do not own. We do not have full control of these channels, but can use them for conversations and interaction with our customers. For these channels we have to follow their requirements and guidelines for content, interaction and measurement of customer experiences.

layers.name: Engagement services
layers.short_description: The Engagement Services layer consists of all capabilities to engage with our customers and partners, add value in the interaction, and sell & service our products & services from all organisation departments via an omni-channel approach delivering one face to our customers and partners.
layers.description: The Engagement Services layer consists of all capabilities to engage with our customers and partners, add value in the interaction, and sell & service our products & services from all organisation departments via an omni-channel approach delivering one face to our customers and partners.
